page.title: 06HOME CARE-CATTERICK-TUNSTALL
page.content: The farmhouses, owned by the County Council, are well maintained. The tenants decorate the interior themselves whereas council tradesmen are employed to preserve the exterior. Private farm owners are encouraged to keep their property in good order and there is no farmstead dereliction in this area, The council housing estate at Tunstall is kept up to standard, the woodwork e.t.c. being repaired whenever necessary, A large percentage of houses are owner occupied and to make any major changes to any property requires planning permission, the older type houses are built of Yorkshire stone, more modern day houses are pebble dashed or built of red brick. All roofing tyles must conform to the type laid down by the council policy.
